data.question: What is the critical temperature at which [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] undergoes a paraelectric−ferroelectric transition?
What method was used to prepare [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3]?
True or False: The crystal structure of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] at 290 K and 110 K belongs to the same space group.
What changes occur in the NH4+ cations within the structure of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] during the transition from 290 K to 110 K?
data.answer: The NH4+ cations transition from a disordered state at 290 K to an ordered state at 110 K.

data.question: What is the role of hydrogen bonding in the ferroelectric transition of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3]?
data.answer: Hydrogen bonding plays a key role in the electric ordering during the disorder−order transition of NH4+ cations.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] involves the use of ammonium formate, formic acid, and Zn(ClO4)·6H2O in methanol.
What experimental technique was used to confirm the phase purity of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3]?
How does the unit cell volume change from 290 K to 110 K for [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3]?
data.answer: The unit cell volume nearly triples from 290 K to 110 K.

data.question: True or False: The ferroelectric transition of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] is characterized by a change in space group from nonpolar to polar.
What is the significance of the Curie constant and Curie−Weiss temperature obtained from the dielectric permittivity measurements of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3]?
data.answer: They are indicative of a ferroelectric transition undergoing disorder−order transitions of H-bonding systems.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis yield of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] based on the starting zinc salt is 88%.
What is the crystal system of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] at 290 K?
True or False: The NH4+ cations in [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] form hydrogen bonds with the anionic framework at both 290 K and 110 K.
What is the effect of temperature on the dielectric permittivity of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3]?
data.answer: The dielectric permittivity shows very high anomaly peaks at 191−192 K, characteristic of a ferroelectric transition.

data.question: True or False: The spontaneous polarization of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] decreases on cooling below the critical temperature.
What is the significance of the endothermic peak observed in the DSC curve of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3]?
data.answer: It corresponds to the paraelectric−ferroelectric transition.

data.question: True or False: The NH4+ cations in [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] show a shift along the c-axis direction at 110 K compared to 290 K.
What is the role of the slow diffusion method in the synthesis of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3]?
data.answer: It affords hexagonal plate or bipyramidal crystals up to 2 mm in size.

data.question: True or False: The ferroelectric transition of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3] is not confirmed by dielectric hysteresis loops.
What is the impact of the disorder−order transition of NH4+ cations on the ferroelectric properties of [NH4][Zn(HCOO)3]?
data.answer: It triggers the paraelectric−ferroelectric phase transition, contributing to the observed ferroelectricity.
